q1.question: A ____ is a data structure that typically consists of n nodes and n - 1 edges. Each node may have several ____ or lower neighbors. The ____ in this data structure are nodes that have a degree of 1 which means they are only connected to their ____. Due to the ____ nature of this data structure, each node can be considered the ____ of a ____.

q2.question: Which of the following statements are true regarding binary trees, heaps, and binary search trees (choose all that apply)?

responses.bst_balance: Binary search trees are always balanced.
responses.heap_sort: Binary heaps can be used for sorting in O(nlogn) time.
responses.bst_sort: Binary search trees be used for sorting in O(nlogn) time.
responses.heap_value: Binary heaps can determine the lowest value in a collection in O(1) time.
responses.bst_value: Binary search trees can determine the lowest value in a collection in O(1) time.
